div.p: 1. The dominant general term for difference is yì 異 (ant. tóng 同 "be the same").
2. Fēn 分 and bié 別 is a difference established by humans through convention or by an intellectual effort. See DISTINGUISH
3. Chà 差 (ant. děng 等 "be without difference established by social conventions") refers to a difference established through social practice.
4. Shū 殊 (ant. jìn 近 "essentially close to", yī 一 "be one and the same") refers abstractly to a categorial distance.
rough draft to BEGIN TO identify synonym group members for analysis, based on CL etc. 18.11.2003. CH ／

note.p: DIFFERENTIA est duorum aut plurium ab invicem, re aliqua distantia.
Constat 1. Duobus, qui conferuntur. et 2. Uno tertio, in quo conferuntur 3. Illorumqve hinc et hinc Discessu a media forma.
varium refers to differences within a given thing, "varied".
versicolor refers to something that is varied in colour, or changes in colour.
diversum refers to something different from other things "distinct".
contrarium refers to something that is not only distinct but directly the opposite of something else.

bibl.title: SYNONYMES FRANÇOIS, LEURS DIFFÉRENTES SIGNIFICATIONS, ET LE CHOIX QU'IL EN FAUT FAIRE Pour parler avec justesse
SYNONYMES FRANÇOIS, LEURS DIFFÉRENTES SIGNIFICATIONS, ET LE CHOIX QU'IL EN FAUT FAIRE Pour parler avec justesse
古漢語常用詞同義詞詞典
A New Dictionary of Classical Greek Synonyms

sense.def: be two > be different (from each other); dualistic
separate oneself from; be separate from; be divided in

entry.def: Fēn 分and bié 別 is a difference established by humans through convention or by an intellectual effort. See DISTINGUISH

sense.def: difference in/between N; distinction; distinguishing features
cause N1 to remain different from N2; separate N1 from N2

entry.def: Fēn 分and bié 別 is a difference established by humans through convention or by an intellectual effort. See DISTINGUISH

sense.def: be different from the contextually determinate N
make different, ensure that (something) becomes different> modify (note the contrast with DISTINGUISH)
to separate so as to V, to become different so as to V

entry.def: Chà 差 (ant. děng 等"be without difference established by social conventions") refers to a difference established through social practice.

sense.def: CHEMLA 2003: differenceThis word occurs only in the commentaries, and not in JZ. One might think of 差 as the result the operation of substraction. In the formulation xy 差 "difference between x and y" the reference is to the result of subtracting the smaller one of x and y from the larger.JZ 9.5, Liu Hui's comm: 是其冪以股弦差為廣股弦并為袤 "As for this its quantified extension one takes the difference between the height and the hypotenuse as width, and one takes the sum of the height and the hypotenuse as length." Note that while bìng 并 is used both before and after the two terms added, and can even intervene between the two, chà 差 only occurs in "inverse Polish notation" word order, after the two terms between which the difference is calculated.JZ 9.15: 句弦差減股為圓徑 "Subtracting the difference between the base and the hypotenuse from the height makes the diameter of a circle."JZ 9.15, Liu Hui's comm: 以句弦差乘股弦差而倍之，開方除之... "Multiplying the difference between the base and the hypotenuse by the difference between the height and the hypotenuse, doubling this and dividing the result (note that 之 regularly refers to the result of the operation immediately preceding, thus not being strictly anaphoric) by extraction of the square root..."When the difference between x and y itself becomes a term in further calculation, it can be referred to only by chà 差, never by 減. The operation itself, also, must then always be designated with chà 差.
distinction made; differentiation in practice; hierarchical differentiation
CHEMLA 2003: differenceJZ 9.6, Liu Hui's comm: 減此差冪於矩冪 "One subtracts the square of this difference from the quantified extension of the gnomon."
be different from N; be an exception
deviate from each other, be inconsistent with each other

entry.def: Shū 殊 (ant. jìn 近 "essentially close to", yī 一 "be one and the same") refers abstractly to a categorial distanc

sense.def: mark oneself out from; be different from
treat (something/somebody N1) as different from (something else N2)
be different from the contextually determinate N

entry.def: The dominant general term for difference is yì 異 (ant. tóng 同 "be the same").

sense.def: stand out; be different from the ordinary, extraordinary, exceptional, phenomenal
be different... be different: the two are different from one another
(of several subejcts) diverge, differ from each other, be different; be extraordinary, be remarkable
to be different from, to differ from something 異於 [also: 異乎]
differ from each other as to (e.g. customs etc) see also 異乎
cause the N to be different; make sure that the N should be different
be caused to differ: be made different
differ with respect to; differ in respect of. Also: be different from
make a significant difference (intellectually, morally, philosophically)
CHEMLA 2003: (in later (seventh cent. or Song) mathematical texts:) difference
by a wide margin of difference
be figuratively distant from> be widely different, be far different
difference HN: 醜美有間焉 "There is a difference between the ugly and the beautiful"
be different from; be at variance with
cause to be various/multifarious> make different, make vary
be wavering with regard to, be inconstant with regard to
difference from the ordinary, extraordinariness; uniqueness
[vt+N] "differ from each other with respect to surname" [probably no need for this entry!]
cloud and mud > be as different as cloud and mud > be different
to become different so as to V, to become separate so as to V
be different (as the states of Chu from Yue, who were constantly at war)
be different (as the states of Chu from Yue, who were constantly at war)
to make NP{=N1 N2} differ, distinguish between (N1 and N2)
